Class Pagination

Use pagination when you have multiple pages of data to handle.

See demo

<ibm-pagination [model]="model" (selectPage)="selectPage($event)"></ibm-pagination>

In your selectPage() method set the model.currentPage to selected page, after you load the page.

selectPage(page) {
    // ... your code to load the page goes here

    this.model.currentPage = page;

    // ... anything you want to do after page selection changes goes here
}

../../iframe.html?id=pagination--basic

selectPage

@Output()
selectPage: EventEmitter<number> = new EventEmitter<number>()
  • Defined in src/pagination/pagination.component.ts:264

Emits the new page number.

You should tie into this and update model.currentPage once the fresh data is finally loaded.

translations

@Input()
  • set translations(value: PaginationTranslations): void
    • Defined in src/pagination/pagination.component.ts:237

    Expects an object that contains some or all of:

    {
        "ITEMS_PER_PAGE": "Items per page:",
        "OPEN_LIST_OF_OPTIONS": "Open list of options",
        "BACKWARD": "Backward",
        "FORWARD": "Forward",
        "TOTAL_ITEMS_UNKNOWN": "{{start}}-{{end}} items",
        "TOTAL_ITEMS": "{{start}}-{{end}} of {{total}} items",
        "TOTAL_ITEM": "{{start}}-{{end}} of {{total}} item",
        "OF_LAST_PAGES": "of {{last}} pages",
        "OF_LAST_PAGE": "of {{last}} page"
}

    Parameters

    • value: PaginationTranslations

    Returns void
